    Microsoft Azure Translate API wrapper for Nim

    This implements all v3 methods of the Azure Cognitive Services Translate API in both sync and async form.

    Example Usage

    let client = newHttpClient()
let key = "YOUR_AZURE_API_KEY"
let input_text = @["hello world"]
let to_langs = @["es"]
let translation = translate(client, key, input_text, to_langs)

    AzureTranslateError = object of CatchableError
  code*: int
    Raised when the API returns an error. See msg as well   Source Edit 
    DictExQuery = tuple[text, translation: string]

  asterisk, tag

    raises: [Exception, ValueError],
    tags: [TimeEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect, RootEffect].}

    proc dictionary_lookup(client: AsyncHttpClient; key: string; text: TextQuery;
                       from, to: string): Future[seq[DictionaryLookup]] {...}{.
    raises: [Exception, ValueError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
    Provides alternative translations for a word and a small number of idiomatic phrases. Each translation has a part-of-speech and a list of back-translations. The back-translations enable a user to understand the translation in context. The Dictionary Example operation allows further drill down to see example uses of each translation pair.   Source Edit

    ValueError, IOError, OSError, HttpRequestError, Exception, LibraryError,
    SslError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, KeyError, JsonParsingError,
    AzureTranslateError, JsonKindError],
    tags: [ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}
      Source Edit

    seq[DictionaryExample]] {...}{.raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [
    ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect, WriteIOEffect].}
    Provides examples that show how terms in the dictionary are used in context This operation is used in tandem with Dictionary lookup   Source Edit
